description:
Both [libvirt]/live_migration_flag and [libvirt]/block_migration_flag Nova configs exist. They are used to tweak flags used for live migration without block migration and with block migration. (toggled by --block-migrate flag of nova live-migration command)

The default values are correct where [libvirt]/live_migration_flag doesn't have "VIR_MIGRATE_NON_SHARED_INC" flag:

    live_migration_flag=VIR_MIGRATE_UNDEFINE_SOURCE, VIR_MIGRATE_PEER2PEER, VIR_MIGRATE_LIVE, VIR_MIGRATE_TUNNELLED
    block_migration_flag=VIR_MIGRATE_UNDEFINE_SOURCE, VIR_MIGRATE_PEER2PEER, VIR_MIGRATE_LIVE, VIR_MIGRATE_TUNNELLED, VIR_MIGRATE_NON_SHARED_INC

If you add the VIR_MIGRATE_NON_SHARED_INC or VIR_MIGRATE_NON_SHARED_DISK flag to [libvirt]/live_migration_flag Nova config by mistake, Nova will happily ALWAYS block migration your disks or volumes. This can result in serious data corruption on migrated volumes since volumes will be copied onto themselves.

Nova should add a safeguard so an operator can't add the VIR_MIGRATE_NON_SHARED_INC or VIR_MIGRATE_NON_SHARED_DISK flags by mistake.
title: [libvirt]/live_migration_flag accepts block migration related flags

comments.content:
Right, it is possible to pass block migration flags to the "normal" live migration operation even if it is not intended.

nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py:

    def _live_migration_operation(self, context, instance, dest,
                                  block_migration, migrate_data, dom):
    [...]
        try:
            if block_migration:
                flaglist = CONF.libvirt.block_migration_flag.split(',')
            else:
                flaglist = CONF.libvirt.live_migration_flag.split(',')
    [...]

I'm not sure if we should entirely prevent that. It could be that someone is using that (for whatever reason) and we would break their setup during an upgrade. A warning is appropriate in my opinion. The cloud operators should checks warnings [1]:

    "Warning: Something is not right, should get looked into during the 
    next work week. Administrators should be working through eliminating
    warnings as part of normal work."

References: 
[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/log-guidelines.html#definition-of-log-levels

commit 8ecf93e88a1a6cc49fffc43a964fe49a37e70d24
Author: Markus Zoeller <email address hidden>
Date:   Mon Sep 28 19:33:28 2015 +0200

    libvirt: Log warning for wrong migration flag config options
    
    The config options live_migration_flag and block_migration_flag
    of the [libvirt] section set the flags for the hypervisor for the
    live-migration operation. It is possible to set the flags in a way
    that every live-migration will be a block-migration and vice versa.
    This doesn't make sense and is a misconfiguration.
    
    Because some customers could already have configured their systems in
    this faulty way, this patch set logs a warning if it discovers this,
    instead of blocking the nova-compute service to come up.
    
    Closes-Bug: #1499041
    Change-Id: I37f1e90c8a86a1dcf0fc1e699a018e0784c66e48
